review: When I started I didn’t feel any side effects, I expected tender breasts, I had no weight gain, no mood swings, even three months in and my skin started to clear up.

Took it for about 4 years, before I had the Diane for some years which is similar. Now I’m off it for also 2 years, using a copper IUD. Looking back, the Diane had me more depressed. The Yasmin gave me amazing spotless and vital skin, bigger boobs, nice smooth shiny hair, less peach fuzz on the rest of my body, stable mood, easy periods. The whole last year with the copper IUD has been horrible. In the 2 years without the pill my boobs shrunk incredibly, my sex drive is less, hair is very hard to manage and has a different structure, my skin has a lot of acne and wrinkles and the peach fuzz got a lot worse again. Really considering getting back on the Yasmin.

I have been on this pill for 2 years. The first year and a half was good. Lost weight, cleared acne etc. However, now I am severely tired all the time, my periods are still 7 days long, I have extreme anxiety which is causing relationship breakdowns and constantly crying. I don recommend this pill.

I used this horrible pill for 10 years. It caused me to have horrible mood swings, rage outbursts, changed personality and suicidal thoughts. Last year after having harmed myself I thought I'd quit the pill and turns out the self harm and horrible angry jealous anxious thoughts went away. I'm still a nervous wreck though. I felt like I had no control over my emotions, I was scared I would harm myself, my pets or loved ones. Stay away from this pill, please. Especially if you already suffer from anxiety and depression. Don't wait for the symptoms to go away.

I have been on Yasmin for over 15 years. I have never had any issues other than switching from the Name Brand to the generic. This pill never gave breakouts or adverse reactions. My only issue is that my insurance company refused to cover the cost since it is the Name Brand. I have tried the generic and it is not the same. It produced greater PMS symptoms and also gave me hormonal acne. I am now 33 and considering going off the pill altogether in fear of starting something new. Has anyone else stopped Yasmin? If so could you please share your experience? I am a bit nervous - (not about having a baby) but any side effects from stopping the hormone??
It didn’t cause depression for me. I lost weight and my boobs got bigger. It’s easy to use

I took Yasmin for almost 20 years, from age 18 years old to 37 years old. I never experienced ANY unwanted side effects. My period came every month like clockwork, I could literally time it to the clock. My periods were 5 days (only Monday thru Friday) and light. I never once experienced any spotting or breakthrough bleeding. I scheduled my life around its perfect predictability. I can count on one hand the number of times I missed a dose. I’ve recently had to stop taking Yasmin for my age and other risks for VTE. I miss it dearly and am at a loss about what to transition to because all other non-estrogen methods do not regulate cycles and are not predictable like Yasmin.

I had taken this pill for PCOS for 6 months and that was probably the worst time of my life when I suffered from severe anxiety and depression. While I lost 6 kgs weight and had clear skin, on the other hand I lost my sleep and sanity! The most difficult phase was my mental condition after I stopped taking the pill that I had to seek medical help to get out of that condition! It is strongly advised not to take this pill especially if you are already suffering from any kind of mental health issue.

I wish I would have read these reviews before I had taken this birth control. I feel like doctors don't warn us enough about the side effects so many women report about this. Then again for profit medicine is just about the bottom line not the welfare of the patients. I lost an alarming amount of hair, I've been religious about rogain to help it come back, I changed my doctor to someone who is helping me get my hormones back to normal, and I recovering from clinical depression that it caused. My hair has just started to come back 8-9 months later. This medication really impacted my life and wellbeing. My story is just one of millions I've found out and not even the worst which scares me and should scare others. I've never felt like a medication should be banned so strongly. Please do not take this medication if you value your physical and emotional health.
Should be banned. Mood swings, depression, nightmares, weight gain, aggressiveness to name just a few. Almost ruined my relationship.

Please don't take Yasmin. It cleared my skin up don't get me wrong. But the mental health effects aren't worth the risk. My already poor relationship with food developed into bulimia and I also became really depressed on this pill. I questioned my relationship with my boyfriend, I had no energy to do anything, for days at a time I couldn't bare to leave the house. Please don't do this to yourself.

Been on this pill for 3 years now. Really really worked. Balanced my appetite, helped me maintain my weight, got a lot of compliments on my skin, and no effects on my mental health compared to Levlen which really messed my mental health and weight up. I went on this pill because all of my close friends suggested that it was good. However, 3 years latter my eyesight started getting worse and I went to the optometrist recently and she told me that combination pills causes your sclera to thin overtime! What! I have to wear glasses now and I used to have 20/20 vision! I constantly have dry eyes and can't fight any allergens or foreign particles with my eyes, have constant itchy eyes and blisters on the skin around my eyes due to constant itching! If I knew this would be a side effect I would not have taken it. There’s nothing anywhere that says it.

Been on it for approximately 10 years. I had no crazy side effects. Maybe a bit of weight gain, libido loss. It took away the minimal acne I did have. One thing I have been noticing maybe the last couple of years is terrible migraines on the placebo week. Like constant, will not go away with 6 (spread throughout the day) advil/tylenol/excedrin. Because of this I am considering getting off of it and giving my body a break.  But all in all I wouldn't say this birth control was terrible.

I have had to go on Yasmin twice in the past few years In 2020 in around January I believe is when I first started taking the pill. the reason I had to go on it was because I had my period for 17 days and when I went to the doctor this was the only option given to me. I was definitely a lot more irritable on the pill and smaller things would make me cry. It worked for what I went on it for though, I had a regular period cycle. Due to things shutting down during covid in around May I wasn't able to get my prescription refilled which I was secretly thankful for because the side effects bothered me a lot. Again in 2021 in April I had my period for a month straight the reason I waited so long to go to a doctor this time was bc I knew they were going to put me on birth control which they did again it worked for what It was prescribed for I am still on it now in November 2021. I feel like. I've gotten used to being depressed and often thinking of suicide.

This was the most horrendous experience of my life. Yasmin totally destroyed my brain chemistry/hormone levels, leading to a multitude of crippling changes to my personality, confidence and ability to live. I am shocked this is allowed to be given out to otherwise healthy, happy young women. It could be repurposed as an instrument of torture. My advice is DO NOT TAKE IT.

I started taking this pill on the 27th October, it’s now the 5th November and I have never felt so depressed and anxious In my whole life. As someone that struggles with anxiety anyway I'm aware of the everyday struggles but with this it’s totally severe. I feel as if I can’t do anything without obsessive thoughts that something is going to happen and having this impending doom feeling though there is absolutely nothing wrong within my life? As a whole other than very sore boobs I have had no other side affects but after only 1 week taking this pill I am stopping before it gets any worse.  ⚠️DO NOT RECOMMEND⚠️

I started taking Yasmin over 5 years ago to clear my chin acne caused by PCOS. While it did clear my skin and made my periods lighter my mental health deteriorated more and more. I thought I was going crazy, crying uncontrollably over small things, snap at people, have suicidal thoughts. I also had heart palpitations which I thought was anxiety. It wasn’t until I spoke with others who also experienced the same and saw these reviews that I put 2 and 2 together, and have stopped taking it. Clear skin is not worth the emotional rollercoaster this pill causes!

Terrible experience. Was on it for 10 days before coming off. Had extreme anxiety and depression, crippling panic about my relationships. Mood was stable before. Feel a huge wave of relief now that I’m coming off if it.

I've not been taking this pill for very long but its been the worst few days. I am taking it for Irregular and bad periods and now  I've suddenly started to feel depressed. I constantly get really upset and sometimes shake. This pill is supposed to help acne but I had completely clear skin and now its already breaking out on my cheeks and chin. No weight gain or weight loss but awful depressive mood that you cant get rid of. I don't think I will be able to continue much longer on this pill for my mental health. I'm not sure if its something that will settle with time  but i feel awful.

I have been off hormonal birth control for almost a year. 2 days on Yasmin, and I feel ill. Similar to how I feel when I am about to get my period. I have had to take 3 tums today to keep my acid reflux at bay. I don’t think I’m going to keep taking this. I hope I did not throw whatever cycle I was adjusting to out of whack too much because of this. Time to abstain as protection

This birth control has got me all messed up. Literally. I was prescribed Yasmin when I had breakthrough bleeding with Freya. I was on Yasmin a little over a year and during that time, I started to question all of my relationships. I cried everyday. My hair was falling out and breaking. I felt crazy. My anxiety was through the roof, I didn't sleep and rarely ate, especially because my self esteem became so slow. Now after stopping Yasmin, it has messed up with my fertility. I had normal periods and a normal cycle before going on the pill, all together I was on birth control for 2 years. Now I get a period every 2 and a half months, sometimes shorter, sometimes longer. They vary too, sometimes I'll only spot for a few days and another time I'll bleed for the whole 7. I have been off Yasmin for over a year now and I'm at a loss on what to do. No one will give me solutions except to go back on birth control or start fertility drugs. When did the only solution go to taking drugs ?? Be warned.

BEWARE! I’ve never had issues with birth control pills before or mental health issues. Within a month I noticed a huge change. Depressed, horrible anxiety, crying everyday and felt completely worthless. It got to the point where I was terrified of what was happening  and so was my family. I finally linked it to the pill and stopped. I felt SO much better once it was out of my system and back to how I was before. I understand everyone responds to medications differently but please be cautious in regards to this medication. Very scary.

I didn’t notice any difference in myself until I stopped taking it, been off it for nearly 1 year. Looking back I was a different person I used to cry for no reason at any time, serious mood swings & huge breasts, Yasmin really affected my mood and confidence. When coming off I lost a lot of weight. However since coming off I’ve now got bacne which I never had before. Pros : not getting pregnant and clear skin on my back Cons : everything else

For 9 years I took Yasmin.  In terms of my periods, they were definitely lighter and more manageable but toward the last five years of taking it I had severe aching pains in my legs and glutes each time I had a period while on it.   Throughout this time I also suffered from vitamin deficiency’s, iron, b12, vitD and as a result I now have Osteopenia (low bone density), I also have stomach inflammation which my naturopath says is a result of taking this pill.  I lost a lot of my hair, have very dry skin, and brittle nails.  I’m no longer taking it, wished I got off it sooner.  Definitely not a pill worth taking for the long term.

I was 19 year old when I had to have an emergency life saving surgery as cyst bursted in my stomach. My stomach was filled with blood and I had no idea about my condition. After I recovered I was prescribed a pill that made me feel very ill, gained weight, was hungry all the time. When I was introduced to Yasmin. Literally saved my life. Lost all the weight I put on in no time as regulated my appetite, was feeling happier, more energy, no painful periods, regulated my periods. I was taking it for about a year and I fully recovered and I got pregnant 2 years later with a healthy baby boy. Haven’t had problems since.

So I’ve been on this pill for almost two months now and I love it ! At first I was pretty emotional over food, mood swings, headaches and nausea. But on my second set of pills I’ve been feeling much better. Some side effects I get is occasional headaches, I get hungry more frequently (which was a good thing) I have bad eating habits and this made me want food more and I've had no weight gain on this pill. I think my boobs are growing which is not a bad thing. I was pretty scared to go on the pill knowing people get scary side effects but all reactions are different for everyone. Don’t scare yourself with the bad reviews. You know your body best. I love this pill and I hope it works great for you :)

I love Yasmin! No real issues with it for the past couple years, except a little nausea here and there, but nothing that can’t be managed! No acne, no anxiety/depression, no mood swings, no weight gain! I will be sad if the day comes that I have to switch!

Started taking this in September 2019 and by November I was extremely depressed and deeply sad/emotional. I was suicidal for the first time in years and quit my job and moved city. Depression stayed until March 2020 then pandemic hit and I became very suicidal and addicted to alcohol for first time in life. Started depression medicine and felt a bit better. Came off the pill in June until November and was the happiest I've ever been but didn't link it to being off the pill. Went back on the pill and 1 month later had serious depressive episodes and suicidal ideation. Only now in August 2021 am I linking my Depression to this pill after hearing a friend had the same experience. Stay away from this medicine!

Took Yasmin for 18 months. Experienced severe breast pain for the last 3 months and came off as I was in agony, despite tests coming back normal. 2.5 months after stopping the pill, my hair began shedding like crazy. 9 months later, I’m still loosing my hair and it’s so thin! Still no real answers for this, suspected telogen effluvium from the pill. It’s not growing back and my estrogen is rock bottom. Talking this pill is the single worst thing I have ever done for my health and I beg anyone out there considering to take this because it improves skin and doesn’t cause weight gain to think twice. As I took it for these reasons and am now incredibly depressed.

I have been on Yasmin for a little over a year. I’ve noticed depression out of this world when I was always a happy go lucky person. I’ve lost my sense of humor as well. I never had this with past birth controls. I am going to the doctor tomorrow to switch back to an older one that I was on in the past. I wouldn’t recommend this to friend / family / or foe.

I only rated it 1, because 0 was not an option. As soon as I started to use it, I developed headaches. I had a headache all day, every day. I also started to get migraines and I have never had a migraine in my life, nor did I really suffer from headaches. I got anxiety attacks to the point where I didn't want to walk through or pass a group of people in the supermarket. I cried every single day of my life and became extremely angry. I almost became an atheist, since all I was feeling was this immense darkness and pressure over me. Religion is very important to me, but just didn't see the need for it anymore. I started to hide under my desk just to escape the world. Saying that it was a horrible experience doesn't even justify what it put me through.

I was on Cerazette (Pop Pill) and I loved it but my doctor changed me to Yazmin as she said my spotting and irregular periods was due to a lack of estrogen. She said to take it for 3-6 months to regulate it again. I was only on Yazmin 6 weeks and it had ruined me. I often suffered with my mental health and I presumed it was bad until I started this pill. All I have done is cry and snap at my boyfriend and family, I have no sex drive and no desire to have sex which is not like me, my anxiety is through the roof and I've never been so depressed. I've been removed from it already. My migraines are back. They went while I was on Cerazette but I can honestly say that I thought I knew depression until now. Constant intrusive and dark thoughts and a lack of motivation. I'm only 23.. I shouldn't be this miserable.Do not take this pill!!!! It is horrible

Felt absolutely horrible while taking this pill. I lost my will to do absolutely anything and experienced severe anxiety. I couldn’t enjoy any kind of activity and I did everything like a task. I even took antidepressants and started doing therapy and now I finally decided to stop the pill and hope to bounce back to myself quickly. So please stay safe everyone and be careful with this pill.

It’s disgusting that this pill is allowed to be given to girls. The side effects are a list as long as your arm and half of them aren’t even on the leaflet. I have felt like I have been losing my mind, I genuinely have been worrying about being sectioned because of the insane mood swings, fits of rage, depression, anxiety, all destroying my relationships. Hair loss - my hair is almost gone, so brittle and so thin and comes out by the shedloads in the shower. Also brittle nails- they’ve just been snapping off completely so I’ve had to wear plasters because it hurts so much. Had a blood test to see if I’m deficient in anything but of course I’m not. Confusion and grogginess - my work life has taken a massive hit because I’ve felt so dopey and forgetful and tired. Weight gain - a ridiculous amount. Sex drive- completely gone. This is the worst pill I’ve ever been on, yes your skin gets quite clear but this is NOT worth ruining your life for!!

Please please please do NOT take this pill , I am normally a very upbeat happy person the past few months have been terrible, I was on Yasmin pill I had really low mood, low energy, not wanting to get dressed and go out , bad depression!. I never even put it down to the pill at first was thinking why do I feel like this.  Then 4 weeks ago I thought to my self it’s gotta be the pill, I stopped the pill got the none hormone copper coil fitted and have never felt better - I'm feel back to my normal self again . Writing on any site is not the sort of thing I would normally do but I thought I had to share so dangerous the way it makes you feel xxx

I have been taking this pill for about a month now, although of the bad reviews I have seen on it, I still decided to try it out. I only have 2 bad things to say about this pill and it’s that my breast have been hurting non stop since taking this pill, as well as it is also known to help acne, I find that my skin has gotten more pimples on my face. Maybe it’s because I’m approaching my period, or maybe it’s just the pill. But my breast have been non stop hurting which is unusual for them to hurt more then 1 week. Other then that I have not been into a depression like most people, or feeling too moody. I’m pretty much always in a good mood. I will try and continue this pill to see where it takes me, but if my breast still stay like this I won’t have a choice but to stop taking this pill.

I started taking Yasmin only 2 weeks ago and I’m already stopping, I feel angry all the time, crying, not myself, I feel like a dark cloud is over me and feel like I have depression. It’s been nerve wracking leaving the house, going to work and it’s like I’m loosing my mind. I went on it to help with PCOS because of my irregular periods and PMS, feel like I can’t win, can’t find a pill that works for me and struggle with mood swings and hormones when I’m off the pill too. Would rather not be on Yasmin though, worse feeling down every day and like a different person. Do not recommend, looks like it’s rare that this suits anyone.

I have only been taking this pill for two months. For the first month and break it was fine but ever since the second break I feel like I have gone insane. I am so so glad that I found this chat. I was feeling so low, had so many intrusive thoughts and irritable anxiety. I have been feeling very depressed and just want to hide in bed. No matter what I did or how much I tried to make myself feel better nothing worked and now I am considering getting therapy for the level of anxiety I have reached.  It also personally did not help with my skin, I’m not sure if that’s because I haven’t taken it long enough but for the sake of my sanity I can’t take it anymore. I am in my early 20s and it makes me so sad to think there are teenage girls who probably continue to feel this way and take this contraceptive pill.

Actually one of the only contraceptive pills me and my body have gotten along with, did help to clear up my skin (although I believe spots were caused from a previous pill) however had to stop taking after having 2nd dose of AstraZeneca vaccine as I had resting heart rate of over 100bmp constantly and heart palpitations. This pill on average can make women 3x more likely to have blood clots and I don't think enough research has been done into the side effects of that mixed with Covid vaccines.

I’m having the worst experience with Yasmin. I started taking it in March and I almost immediately experienced the side effects but I thought it would get better once my body adjusted to it. For a while I was better and out of nowhere things changed. I am overly emotional, I cry all the time, I have zero control over my emotions, I’m sad and depressed and it’s started to affect my relationship coz I’m starting to lash out at my boyfriend, I’m insecure and jealous and I believe the tricks that my mind is playing on me. I’m overly sensitive and take things way to personal. I have no control over my thoughts whatsoever and I have really dark thoughts. Today was my last day on the pill, definitely would not recommend it. Avoid it at all costs for your peace of mind.

Absolutely horrendous - went from 55kg to 68 kg and I’m only 5ft2 * in a matter of 3 months. I feel terrible about myself and I can’t fit into any of my clothes it’s ruined my summer. I’ve stopped taking it today so I hope that I can get myself back to feeling good enough to go out !

Was fine for the first month, but started to notice my anxiety was worse, boobs grew (not completely a bad thing), gained about 10lbs, no sex drive and felt ill and awful about myself all the time. Do not recommend Yasmin for younger girls especially in their lates teens/early 20’s. Have not felt like myself since, have found it’s made me more stressed and anxious 24/7. Took my last pill Saturday and am not taking the next pack, not worth all the side effects.

I changed to this pill after I was told to stop Dianette due to its increased risk of blood clots. I’d never had an issue on the pill previously. Since beginning this pill I have realised my mental health has slowly declined. This is probably the scariest thing as I didn’t actually realise how much I had changed as a person until it was already doing damage. I began having low moods, energy, and worst of all having such a lack of confidence compared to myself before this pill 8 months prior. Everybody is different and we will all react differently to contraception but I just want to let those know who don’t feel themselves on this pill don’t just brush it off and ask to change if you feel something isn’t right for you!

I was taking the generic version of Yasmin off and on for 3 years. I would take Month long breaks because of the side effects I was experiencing. Recently I stopped the pill because of severe heart palpitations, the last episode lasted 20 minutes and I considered calling an ambulance. I would have left sided chest pain weekly. I was light headed when standing up. I had blurry, fuzzy vision constantly. When I was NOT running everyday I would instantly get sore, stiff calves. My hair is super thin at the crown, when I lift the crown hair up I can see the scalp two inches in. My mood is horrible, irritable, and depressive. I did have very dark thoughts and cried a lot. I cried even over happy things which is not how I usually am. I will never take this pill again. I recommend everyone to do their own research about Yasmin and the lawsuits others have filed. The side effects are real and life threatening.

So in March I got infected by coronavirus and had side effects after recovery. One side effect or after effect of COVID was irregular periods. My gynac recommended Primolut N for about 5 days to kick start my periods but it didn’t really help. So I started taking Yasmin on suggestion by my doctor and let me tell what this pill does. It’s just so awful, it made me gain some weight, gave me acne, made me constipated and I was nothing but a walking catastrophe. Got severe anxiety and I cry CONSTANTLY. I’ve never felt so unstable in my entire life. Going off it in 2 days, really hope this pill has worked and that I don’t have to take it anymore cause if I continue taking this pill, I’ll have to go live alone as my family will not be able to tolerate me anymore.

Took this pill for about 2 years. It really affected my mental health, and it took me a while to realise that it was the pill. I was really depressed, anxious and crying despite nothing objectively 'bad' happening in my life. I also felt this tension throughout my body and didn't feel like myself. So glad that I'm off this pill now. As for skin, it didn't make my skin significantly better and potentially made it worse by all of the stress that I was experiencing.

This pill helped my PCOS caused me to gain 8kg and my boobs are way larger. I’m really bloated a lot of the time when I eat any kind of fast food. The first few months on this pill I was quite emotional and bled constantly but this stopped after about 3 months and felt better. I got depressed when I stopped taking a pill for a break (which was advised by my doctor). But it made me so sad and anxious. I would cry every day and think that my boyfriend was cheating on me. I take a pill break to allow a break from the hormones which stops them from building up in my body and I feel way better. I started working out a lot to help my mood swings and anxiety which helped with mood. The pill helped my skin a tiny bit (I am also on oxytetracyline now which has helped so much in combination with the pill).  If you take this pill you need to be working out a lot and eating really healthy/just looking after yourself in general in order to minimise the negative effects. It is a good pill compared to others
Wasn’t the best made me feel very down and tired all the time also had a lot of mood swings for no reason

I had a pulmonary embolism from this birth control in 2011 and almost died. Literally died and was brought back to life. This pill leaves you 4x more likely to have a life threatening side effect than other birth controls. That being said, if it didn’t have that risk I would say it’s an awesome option because it kept my endometriosis at bag, I felt good, didn’t gain weight and wasn’t moody.

So, overall Yasmin has been pretty good! I was pretty put off by all of the reviews but I decided to give it ago because every body is different! Lets start with the positives- I feel less stressed about pregnancy (I still use condoms just in case though), my acne has stayed the same as it was when I took pills just for acne - providing I have a good routineNegatives- I had quite a lot of nausea which comes and goes but overall is manageable but can make me quite tired! I had a lottt of spotting and bleeding but I didn't find it much of an issue apart from the fact that I have to wear pads all the time. Sometimes I was a bit achy- especially my boobs but they definitely got larger! Before taking Yasmin, I had been diagnosed with depression and anxiety and my biggest concern about taking Yasmin was that I'd heard it makes your mental health worse, but for me it has stayed the same with sometimes feeling a bit more emotional over small things, but it's manageable!

I love it while I’m on it but on the weeks break I feel genuinely insane. I will start on anyone, cry for no reason and have no impulse control. I never manage the full 7 day break because the mood swings are so much

I couldn't be on this medication for more than a month because I bled, had diarrhea and vomiting NON-STOP from the moment I started it till I finally stopped taking it. I had never been so sick in my life to the point I'm scared to try other hormonal birth control again, regardless of what format it is in. I don't want to scare anyone too badly, but remember this drug has been recalled several times for causing blood clots and causing death in many young women, causing Bayer millions of dollars in lawsuits (Yasmin and Yaz). If you want hormonal BC, I'd go with another form of progestin like Levonorgestrel or something and NOT drospirenone. I know that having reliable birth control is important, but so is your health, wellbeing and your life!

I’m not sure whether Yasmin has caused the negative feelings I’ve experienced but from reading other reviews it does make me wonder. I’ll start with the positives- it does it’s main job of preventing pregnancy and has definitely helped my skin clear up. I’ve suffered badly with acne all my life and this has been the only thing I’ve tried which gives me nice skin.  My boobs are a little bigger too. Now onto the bad stuff. Every month when I come on I get really bad headaches. I also get really moody and upset over not very much at all. It feels like you have to pick whether to have nice skin or be a nice person! It really has made me feel the lowest I’ve ever felt on some days.
The best birth control pill you could be on

I was on Yasmin to get rid of my shocking period cramps and it took for 1.5 months before the effects fully kicked in. It made me extremely depressed with serious thoughts of self harm. I had massive breakdowns for days on end and have never felt so low/depressed in my life. I completely changed as a person when was on this and I could not stress enough to not go on this pill.

I've been using Yasmin for around 2.5 years now. Originally I loved it! I wasn't really noticing many side affects. It has kept me from becoming pregnant so it worked. But in the last year though, things have changed. My mental health has spiralled, I cry all the time and generally feel depressed. Only now looking back do I see that I actually did slowly start to change when I went on the pill. I did gain weight, not at a fast pace but I feel it is noticeable. I have horrible cramps and also the worst migraines that would leave me crying and wearing sunglasses in my house so the light wouldn't irritate me. I thought it was just stress but I've been stressed before the pill and never felt this way.I would cautiously recommend this pill. It did it's main job in stopping me from becoming pregnant but it just isn't the right form of contraception for me anymore.

I started on Yasmin when I was 17 due to terrible cramping, mood swings, and back pain. The pill is a life saver and I cannot recommend it enough. I will say I did slightly gain weight but that was probably the only side effect I noticed.

I used Yasmin for 4 months when I decided to stop due to the side effects. I had terrible mood swings, headaches, I was always bloated.  I gained some weight as well, but most importantly, it ruined my skin completely. I had huge and painful pimples on my chin and jaw area that were never healing. I noticed that during the 7 days break, I would not get new breakouts so eventually I decided to quit the pill. Few weeks after stopping the pill I felt a huge difference. My weight is back to normal, no headaches, no mood swings. My skin cleared in just one month and I have no breakouts now, but the damage on my skin was so big that I'm still struggling to heal the scars left. I felt from the beginning that something was not right and went back to the doctor to ask for advice, but they told me to wait few more months for the pill to work. I waited 2 more months. However, I just felt it was getting worse and worse and decided to listen to my body and quit... And I'm very happy I did so.

I started Yasmin a year ago after some complications with my birth control. I found not a whole lot of side effects while on it besides being very sad and angry. Reading the reviews, I think my hair has thinned out as well. Going off Yasmin is a whole different story. I stopped my birth control on hopes to prepare my body to get pregnant. Going off I did not get my period for 2 months to begin with now, it's all irregular periods since October. Since my last period, it has been 50 days. I'm concerned for my fertility now too. Besides not getting my period, I have gained 15 pounds. Summer is coming fast and I am struggling to get back to my normal weight. I am making a doctor's appointment today as I feel this pill possibly have me pill induced PCOS or something along those lines. I will never take birth control, especially this one.

I had irritable mood swings but nothing too bad. The one biggest side effect for me that made me switch was the migraines I was getting while taking the placebos. I have just started taking Levora, which my doctor recommended taking 3 straight months and then having my period to minimize the migraines. So far I've had breakthrough bleeding and heavy as well for about a week. I hope it gets better.

I have been on Yasmin for about 4 years now and I have had no problems/ side effects. I have had no weight gain (except maybe a little in my breasts which isn't an issue for me), have had lighter periods and very little menstrual cramps (and I used to have a full 7 day heavy, and painful period), and can't even remember the last time I got a pimple.

I'm 30 and tried many different pills since I was 14. (Microgynon 50ED being the longest used). I went off the pill for 3 years at 27, then started on Yasmin for 6 months and had a lot of breakthrough bleeding. My doctor then switched to the Implanon (under skin implant) for 4 months, breakthrough bleeding continued, got massive headaches. I then had it removed and have now been back on Yasmin for a further 5 months. Non-stop bleeding, some days heavy, some light, bad acne breakouts, extremely tender breasts, bloating, emotionally unstable, mood swings and panic attacks - all of which I've never had in my life! I also have polycystic ovarian syndrome and this has not improved this at all.

I've just started Yasmin. I was on Diane-35 last year, then stopped, but the water weight didn't seem to go away and I had cellulite, that I had never had before Diane-35. In 9 days, I've lost about 2kg. My mood seems fine so far. Have to visit bathroom more often. The best thing - I'm about a cup size up, from B to about C now. It's fantastic and I cannot wait for my boyfriend to see them! Diane-35 made me feel awkward and out-of-place, because of the sudden water weight on legs, bottom, arms, tummy, etc, but I feel so light on Yasmin.Yasmin gave me back my flat tummy (I had some bloating problems). First month in and it's been fantastic. Cannot stop looking in the mirror.

Initially I was on Yasmin for 1 Year.  Noticeable changes/side effects were:Weight-loss, Hair-thining, More emotional, Lighter periodsI went off it for a month (I forgot to renew my prescription) and in that month I put on about 2kg, was not so emotional and my period was a little heavier.  Also, the first two weeks of being off Yasmin, my body was super-sensitive!  Possibly both a good and bad thing?  I am now back on Yasmin and the old side-effects are kicking in again.  Overall, I would say it works well with my body so will continue to use it.  Recommend it if it works with your body too, the only way to tell is to try it really.

I have been on Yasmin for about 3 years. For the first year, there was little to no weight gain. Second year I found my appetite was never satisfied with whatever I ate. I could just keep eating and eating if it tasted good. Not sure if that was my fault or if it was the pill. Now, as for year three, experiencing severe depression I cry for no reason and it will be all day and I can't stop. I have started spotting and almost getting a full on period the week before my period. I gave it a 7 because it has been pretty good to me other than these things to be able to stay on it for 3 years, but I think if you're on it for too long it can have some bad side effects. It was AWESOME for the first year or so.

I've been on Yasmin and then Ocella for 7 years, and I have absolutely loved it.  3 day light periods, significantly cleared up my acne, lost weight, my breasts looked great!  No PMS, no mood swings.  Because of all the recent lawsuits my mom begged me to switch pills, so my doctor had me try Loestrin.  So far I have 7 day breakthrough periods, lost 2 pounds, my breasts shrank a cup size-they are sagging and I'm 26! My back hurts all the time. If it doesn't straighten out I'm going back to Yasmin/Ocella!

I was put on Yasmin for 6 months to regulate my cycle and reduce acne flare-ups and it was the worst 6 months of my life. I gained 20lbs that did NOT come off easily after stopping the pill, experienced horrible mood swings, had HEAVIER periods, acne breakouts, breakthrough bleeding, and I was nauseous all the time. This pill seems to agree with most people but it definitely did not agree with me. I went on Femcon a year after stopping Yasmin and experienced virtually no side effects.

I used Yasmin for 10 years and had no problems at all.  Periods were light and predictable.  No mood swings.  Everything was good.  After 10 years on it, I started experiencing hot flashes but I am too young for menopause.  Apparently, long use causes this and is easily rectified by getting off for a few months and restarting.

Yasmin kept my skin clear and my period 'normal' for years.  As soon as I stopped it, life became disastrous again.  My face was oily and broke out.  I had coarse facial chin hair growing constantly.  Periods were heavy with cramps I had to take 800mg Ibuprofen for.  I started taking them again after 6 months off....  Upon resuming, in the 1st month I had NO significant change in acne or facial hair.  The second month, slight  breast tenderness and, my face was less oily.  Breakouts are LESS but not gone yet.  There is less facial hair.    Into month 3, breast tenderness is gone and improvements in skin and hair continue.  This pill is great for women with PCOS like myself.  I should have never stopped using it on the first place.

Amazing pill. I took Yasmin for 5 years with no side effects except low libido which is why I eventually switched pills. Overall light short cramp free periods. Worked great for me, no PMS at all. And best part is I never got pregnant, very good. When I wanted to get pregnant I was only off Yasmin for 1 month before conceiving my son. All in all it was a great pill.

This was the first (and only) birth control I have ever used, so I will say upfront that the effects it had on me may have resulted in any birth control use not just from Yasmin. I used Yasmin for about 2 months and in that amount of time it had almost completely killed my sex drive. I could not reach "climax" whereas I had not had a problem before and had almost no desire for sex. In addition I became so dry that when I did have sex it would burn and be painful. I did gain some weight but I'm not sure if I could really blame it on the birth control except for the fact my breasts went up a cup size and still haven't shrunk though I've lost weight. The weight may have been put on easier on Yasmin? Hair got thicker also but no baby!

I've been on Yasmin for about a year now. I was on Ortho-Tri for a few years prior to that, and Nordette (another birth control pill) a few years prior to that one. Because I've been on a pill for so long, my body didn't need much adjusting to Yasmin, nor did I notice any HUGE side effects. Although, after reading some reviews, I have noticed that I feel more sensitive emotionally now since being on Yasmin, I don't feel like I get mood swings per say where I'm mad, more like its easier for me to cry for something I normally wouldn't have cried so easily before. Also, I've noticed more frequent migraine headaches, and my hair is thinner but despite this, I think its still the best one for me out there. They all have pros, cons, and risks!

I have been on pretty much every birth control pill out there, all with side effects that were serious enough for me to have to go off of them. I started taking Yasmin and for the first time I had no break through bleeding, no side effects. I was on it for about two years when I decided to go off of it to have a baby. I used a back up method for about 6 months and then tried to get pregnant. One night, one try and I was pregnant. So I think it works well at preventing pregnancy! When the time came to go back on the pill I was concerned I wouldn't be able to get it because of all the stuff I've been hearing. My doctor said that there are increased risks but that the risks are minimal, especially given that I'm under 35 and don't smoke.

I was having a horrible time on Ocella which contrary to what your local pharmacist will tell you, is NOT the same as Yasmin. So my doctor switched me to Yasmin and the first month was great, no more horrible mood swings, I was almost on euphoric high. The second month I completely crashed, I started having hot flashes, mood swings, ovarian pain, hair loss, anxiety and a general feeling of non-well-being. ASIDE from that, my period was fine, not too bad.
Made me so irritable! I've never experienced PMS, but when I was on this medication, I was so emotional - even when not menstruating.

Yasmin was great for the couple years I was on it, but about a month after I quit taking it my hair started to shed more than usual.  After three months I had about a 40% decrease in hair volume and became noticeably thin on top.  This is very devastating because I am an attractive, healthy 27 yer old.  This is the side effect they don't warn you of.
Was using Ocella for a year and gained 10 pounds. Switched to Yasmin, big difference losing weight and my hunger attacks stopped. Recommend it.

I've taken Yasmin for probably the last 3 years, but I've been using other birth control pills for 12 years and the pill I was using made me gain about 7-8 lbs of water weight. That's when my doctor put me on Yasmin, in a few days I lost the water weight, I don't get cramps, no mood swings, my periods last for 3-4 very light days and I only have them every 3 months, so if your doctor says you can take Yasmin I highly recommend it.

I have been on Yasmin since I was 15.  My periods used to last 9-11 days, were heavy, and very painful.  I can remember my mom keeping me out of school due to this.  Not only was my cycle completely crazy, I had acne on my shoulders, upper back, and upper arms.  Being in high school, something like this can be traumatizing.  Anyway after almost 6 years, I have been acne free (maybe the occasional bump or 2) and 4-5 day easy periods!  I did gain weight...but who knows if it was because of the birth control...like the lady said before she gained in all the "right" places so I can't complain about that one.  I went up a whole up size! I plan on taking this until I decide to make a little one (another 4 years hopefully).

I have been on Yasmin for 5 years, since I was 16. I stopped it for a few months (I switched jobs and lost my insurance). In that time I went to a clinic and was given their low-cost birth control pills. Once I got back on yasmin, I stopped having breakthrough bleeding, headaches, nausea, and everything in between. So of the two or three birth control brands I have tried, Yasmin is by far the best.

Out of all the birth control pills, this one is best!  Gained some weight in the "right" spots :)  Less PMS, if any @ all, lighter periods/flow.  And this pill is safe enough to take for 3 consecutive months, so you can have your period only 4 times a year!!!  That's so AWESOME!

I've taken depo for about 5 years I have a very serious large amount of cyst in both my ovaries, a few Dr. have told me I have PCOS and I use to be in alot of pain from the cyst.  My Dr. sugested surgery to remove my ovaries, so I went to a different Dr.  My new Dr. prescribed be Yasmin as a birth control instead of the Depo I've been taking, it was so it would stop me from ovulating at all and sure enoughf within a month the pain was gone.  Yasmin helped me get rid of my ovarian cyst problem.
